comment: This professor is awful. His lectures and powerpoints are vague and usually do not make sense. He is very spacey and does not have clear speech. He mumbles and rambles all the time. He actually looked into space and started texting in the middle of class. Study guides suck. Tests are very hard. He talks about racism ALOT. Watch useless videos a lot

He is a very personable guy and is easy to get along with, but I would NOT ever take a class with him again. He is very inarticulate in his lectures, the PowerPoint presentations rarely ever have useful information on them. His tests feel like they were thrown together in five minutes, and have many errors in them.

Please listen to all of the comments on this professor!  His tests are extremely different from the notes.  Even though he lets us take the tests on line, the notes don't help at all.  His powerpoints are extremely vague and class is really just a waste of time.  He's just read something off a powerpoint and then say "You know what I'm sayin'"

He is very entertaining to listen to however he really likes to go off topic. His power points are very vague and his test questions are specific. If you go to class and listen to his lectures you may be able to pick on on an answer to a test from what he verbally said in class, but you will not find it in the power points or additional reading

Professors lecture doesn't follow book & barely follows Powerpoint.He mumbles when talking.Study guide is all over the place & doesn't follow historical time line per book.Tests are harder than advised & questions are difficult to understand. Don't be deceived,Professor doesn't give leeway on grading,doesn't follow through on homework or quizes.

He talks more about his personal opinion then the actual history of the country.  His tests can be very unclear in the questions.  His death by false power point teaching style killed my love of history.
Very vague with test material. TESTS ARE VERY HARD! Reads straight from powerpoint. Attendance mandatory. Class with him was a mistake.

Terrible teacher, Do not take him. He gave us our final grade's before he even graded our final. He doesnt help you,. no extra credit. And his tests are hard. He should be teaching black history, not american history.

Go to class, do the very little homework,read what he post online, do the study guide and you will do fine. 2 of his test are online and the final is in class. I did fine in this class, but I put in a lot of my own time... if you don't want to put in time you will not do well... I ended up with an A

This Professor was not clear at all. He was nice, and he was funny and he's probably cool as a person, but he was not a very good professor. It may have been different if he himself knew what he was talking about and was interested in the subject he was teaching. The tests do not make sense and the material we were told to study was not on the test

I agree with the previous post, his views are far to the left and he cannot back them up in a debate.  Also he does not teach, the majority of class is spent watching short videos.  The class is American History however he is teaching predominately black history.

Professor Hight is often unclear in what he tells you during class. He is a far left wing professor who believes that the biggest impact on the 20th century was racism. Our first test which was from 1880 to 1920 had nothing to do with anything but social and racial movements. If you are an intelligent person I advise that you do not take this class

3 test all year-2 online and 1 in class. Study guides were given for the test, and somewhat narrowed down the topics covered in the test. However, teaching style is not very clear and does not give too many specifics, although much of the information comes from in class power points. Attendance was haphazardly taken, and grades posted very late.

He would review for tests saying: "Women's rights..know some stuff about that..look over the last bit of notes we took..check out Reaganomics and know a little bit about that.." Very unclear about what to study for tests. Only an easy A for a history buff - take someone else if you are looking to actually learn something or make an A.

Easy class. He was hilarious. I would recommend taking this prof. 2 of online tests and 1 in class. The homework and attendance were used at the end of the semester to decide if your grade should be bumped up 3-5 points.

EASY A..Didn't take roll until alot of people started skipping.  3 tests for whole semester 2 online and 1 the final in class. He gives study guides for test. 4 homework assignments the whole semester. RECOMMEND TAKING HIS CLASS!!

He was disorganized. Students started skipping class so he took role randomly. He posted grades late so you weren't sure of where you stood.  There were only 3 or 4 tests, but more HW.  What bothered me the most is that he tended to get off topic and talked more about current events as opposed to the topic at hand which was frustrating.

If you take him you will pretty much be teaching yourself. He never goes over notes. He says "you can just read about this at home" and then he talks about stuff irrelevant to the class. I'm a straight A student and I had to really FIGHT for this A. If he would have actually taught the class then it would have been so much easier to get that grade.

Passionate teacher that really enjoys his job. Our tests were onlined and timed, if you organize your notes that he gives you the tests are easy. He is very understanding and is willing to work with you if you do not turn in your homework on time. STRONGLY RECCOMMEND!!
good professor. Easy A.

Very easy. Get over the tests being 'difficult'. It's college. He gives you pretty much exactly whats on the test anyways... people were just too lazy to put effort into them. People whined and complained way too much for such a nice guy and laid back class.

SLOW to return grades!! I had no idea what my grade was even th day before the final.  He's an alright teacher, kinda easy if you try.  His test arent that easy but the study guides he gives covers alot.  Much of his lectures were topics of racial issues in the recent history. VERY emphasized, but somewhat interesting. He does care about the class.

I wouldn't say he was an EASY A, more like you have to "fight" for your A. Tests are hard I won't lie. Study guides helps 80%, but there is always some questions that throw you off. Not much extra credit (starting Spring '08) but if the majority of the class begs for it, which will happen, he might give in. Good guy though. Discusses racism a LOT

If you are looking for an easy A then this is the class to take. I went to class 3 times the whole semester and I got an A. Almost everything he talks about resorts back to race some how. Very strong on racial issues.  Just do the study guides(Because they are almost exactly like the tests) and you will do fine. Notes also posted online.

Funny guy, looks like a younger Denzel.The material is straight from the book read it and you'll do fine. Test are multiple choice and quizzes are online. Classes are not mandatory. If you DO NOT want an easy A don't take him.
I LOVED HIM!! He was a great teacher that listened to what his students have to say and he also graded fairly. Not to mention that he is EXTRA FINE!!!

A great teacher to take.  Its a night class, but he reminds me of Denzel Washington in Remember the Titans.  Really funny, and always gives a study guide.  Does not always take attendance, but it really helps being there.  You have a few quizzes online, but answers can be found in book.  I reccommend him HIGHLY!!!!!!
Vey good teacher, makes material easy. one term paper -you choose topic. Must take this teacher!
